PageTitle: display bgp flow vpnv6 vpn-instance routing-table (All views)
FuncDef: The display bgp flow vpnv6 vpn-instance routing-table peer advertised-routes command displays information about BGP VPN IPv6 Flow Specification and BGP VPNv6 Flow Specification routes.
CLIs: display bgp flow vpnv6 vpn-instance <vpn-instance-name> routing-table <reindex>
display bgp flow vpnv6 vpn-instance <vpn-instance-name> routing-table peer <ipv4-address> advertised-routes <reindex>
display bgp flow vpnv6 vpn-instance <vpn-instance-name> routing-table peer <ipv6-address> advertised-routes <reindex>

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of a VPN instance.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported. In addition, the VPN instance name must not be _public_. When double quotation marks are used around the string, spaces are allowed in the string.

Displays information about the route of a specified index.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4294967295.

Specifies an IPv4 address.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Specifies an IPv6 address.
The address is a 32-bit hexadecimal number, in the format of X:X:X:X:X:X:X:X.

Displays information about routes advertised to a specified peer.
-

Examples: <HUAWEI> display bgp flow vpnv6 vpn-instance vpna routing-table 1
BGP flow-ipv6 routing table entry information of 1:
AS-path Nil, origin igp, MED 0, pref-val 0, valid, local, best, pre 0 Not advertised to any peer yet
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The display bgp flow vpnv6 vpn-instance routing-table peer advertised-routes command displays information about BGP VPN IPv6 Flow Specification and BGP VPNv6 Flow Specification routes.
